name: Floodplain Access / Entrenchment
functionStatement: Frequent overbank flows reduce flood peaks, support riparian vegetation, create off-channel refugia, and extend nutrient processing time.
descriptionMarkdown:
Stable, not heavily dredged/incised, allowing normal overbank flows/meanders unless dredging is historical.
Channel is not deeply incised; moderate floods access a broad floodplain, matching reference conditions.
1-2 yr floods routinely access the floodplain, matching reference inundation patterns.
methodContextMarkdown:
Context: Channel; Floodplain

Method: Field; Desktop
howToMeasureMarkdown:
Identify incision, dredging, levees, and spoil banks from imagery and confirm in the field or with historical sources where feasible.
Compute entrenchment ratio as flood-prone width (often about 2x bankfull depth) divided by bankfull width using DEM or LiDAR cross sections and bankfull indicators.
Map bankfull inundation extent using a DEM and bankfull flow estimate and compare to mapped floodplain layers as a proxy for moderate-flood access.

inputs.label: Floodplain Access / Entrenchment
inputs.helpMarkdown: High resolution aerial imagery; Field photos; Brief field recon; Historical evidence

levels.label: Optimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Good: Stable channel that is not incised or dredged with frequent floodplain access. (Suggested index range 0.70-1.0)

levels.label: Suboptimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: Slight channelization or partial dredging. (Suggested index range 0.50-0.69)

levels.label: Marginal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: Heavily modified or incised channel with limited floodplain access. (Suggested index range 0.30-0.49)

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Poor: Deeply dredged or channelized reach with little functional floodplain. (Suggested index range 0.0-0.29)

references: National Levee Database (NLD) and FEMA floodplain layers (where available).
